Package me.aecsocket.calibre.item.component.descriptor

Class ComponentDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aecsocket.calibre.item.component.descriptor.ComponentDescriptor
  • public class ComponentDescriptor
extends Object
    Can create a CalibreComponent if provided with a Registry.

    These are used in tandem with system descriptors so that a user can write, for example: { # the component descriptor "id": "magazine_component", "ammo_storage": { # a system descriptor that describes the "ammo_storage" system "ammo": [ "bullet_type1", "bullet_type2", ... ] } } rather than just writing out the component's (and the systems') definition again.

    It is also not viable to store just a string reference to the ID of the component, as a component's systems can have instance data, which would be replaced with the registry's instance's systems' data (the master copy's) otherwise. This would mean that, for example components with systems which hold ammo would share the exact bullets with every other component of the same ID.

      • create

        @NotNull
public @NotNull CalibreComponent create​(me.aecsocket.unifiedframework.registry.Registry registry,
                                        ComponentTree tree)
                                 throws ComponentCreationException
        Creates the CalibreComponent this can create, also creating the component tree and setting up event handlers.
        Parameters:
        registry - The Registry used for resolving other components.
        tree - The ComponentTree for all components in the tree.
        Returns:
        The created CalibreComponent.
        Throws:
        ComponentCreationException - If the component could not be created.
